page.title: 10ASHGATE ANNEXE, ASHGATE
page.content: {Ashgate Annexe}closed in April 1984. Prior to this the Annexe was the property of the{National Health {Service.}One building was a homely maternity hospital whilst another, in spacious grounds, comprised of two wards for male and female patients who needed long term care. Many of the patients were elderly, recovering from fractured hips, detained really because they were too frail to return to their own homes. During the 1984-5{Miner's Strike}the Annexe was used to billet Police officers who were drafted from distant forces for picket duty. Currently one half of the Annexe has been purchased for an{old people's}home. It is hoped that the other building will be used as a{hospice}for the terminally ill. This is the focus for much public fund raising in Chesterfield.
